intro: Clidemia epiphytica var. trichocalyx, commonly known as the hairy mistletoe, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is an epiphytic plant, meaning it grows on the surface of other plants without deriving nutrients from them. The plant is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens for its ornamental value.
